catalog_info.title: Mathematics in the World
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Mathematics 19b or 21b or 23a; or an equivalent background in mathematics. More importantly, students should have a broad mathematical curiosity and be eager to brainstorm during in-class problem solving sessions.
catalog_info.description: An interactive introduction to problem solving with an emphasis on subjects with comprehensive applications.  Each class will be focused around a group of questions with a common topic: logic, information, number theory, probability, and algorithms.
